head.supplied: May 25th [186]4 ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ By the "Bollingbroke" which sailed on the 14th Inst I sent you a mastive dog (a very fine specimen) and 40 magpies. These I trust will reach you safely. I must say I am...

div.p: From George Sprigg to H. Butler
No. 64/319 p. 599, unit 3, VPRS 2225 outwards letter book, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

By the "Bollingbroke" which sailed on the 14th Inst I sent you a mastive dog (a very fine specimen) and 40 magpies. These I trust will reach you safely. I must say I am somewhat disappointed at not having received something from you [ere] this as it does us but little good to [hear] of what you have at Calcutta eating their heads off. Dr Mueller asks me to send this dog or else I should not have done so as I thought it would be of little use.
